channel.title: Time Out! A sports anthology
channel.description:
*A trophy carries dust. Memories last forever.* -Mary Lou Retton
This series of games all have a Sports theme, and perhaps we'll frame them all in our contemporary world, even if we don't have to constrain ourselves too closely to events in previous games.
As such, while it's highly recommended that you play all of the sessions for each individual game, you aren't expected to sign up to all three games.
Including: Volley Boys!!, 360° Indie Heartgrab & Preparing for Paris. ![TimeOut|499x499](upload://uqFFkE5kE9B64Rrw8A8gtwO7OWn.jpeg)
**Volley Boys!!** Based primarily on Haikyu!! with influences from other sports anime VB!! presents the opportunity for players to play through the character arcs of a sports anime.
[Session 1](https://gauntlet-hangouts.firebaseapp.com/event-detail/-MxEKgb028WMONdY7vwl) [date=2022-05-03 time=20:00:00 timezone="Europe/Dublin"] → [date=2022-05-03 time=23:00:00 timezone="Europe/Dublin"]
[Session 2](https://gauntlet-hangouts.firebaseapp.com/event-detail/-MxEKwPYC4e7yrKcL0te) [date=2022-05-10 time=20:00:00 timezone="Europe/Dublin"] → [date=2022-05-10 time=23:00:00 timezone="Europe/Dublin"]
**360° Indie Heartgrab**
360° Indie Heartgrab is a game about weird skaters shredding asphalt, going on adventures, and growing to care about each other.
It is heavily influenced by Sk8 The Infinity and Golden Sky Stories, and it is both competitive and diceless.
[Sign Up](https://gauntlet-hangouts.firebaseapp.com/event-detail/-MxEMic8wMQZKQQcyioh) [date=2022-05-17 time=20:00:00 timezone="Europe/Dublin"] → [date=2022-05-17 time=23:00:00 timezone="Europe/Dublin"]
**Preparing for Paris** The prestigious and cutthroat high school in which every student is a personified sport! Play as one of 12 available characters all vying for the top spot come graduation, and a taste of Olympic glory.
Make friends, meet rivals, and cause chaos...
[Session 1](https://gauntlet-hangouts.firebaseapp.com/event-detail/-MxENStmcEfNQQEzi2zV) [date=2022-05-24 time=20:00:00 timezone="Europe/Dublin"] → [date=2022-05-24 time=23:00:00 timezone="Europe/Dublin"]
[Session 2](https://gauntlet-hangouts.firebaseapp.com/event-detail/-MxENg4LMJggmgltHwWf) [date=2022-05-31 time=20:00:00 timezone="Europe/Dublin"] → [date=2022-05-31 time=23:00:00 timezone="Europe/Dublin"]
RSVPs open to all on March 5th at 2pm GMT

item.title: Time Out! A sports anthology
item.dc:creator: @Donogh
item.description:
@Donogh wrote:

Bonus session of Final Lap

Sign up for 2022-05-19T19:00:00Z → 2022-05-19T22:00:00Z

Final Lap is a role-playing game for 2 or more players. Based on Alex Roberts’ game For the Queen, and therefore Descended from the Queen, it takes the form of a deck of cards, which we’ll draw as the game progresses. They’ll help us create our story.

Here we are! Grand Rapid Falls! The last race of an exhausting season of the Tour! The crazy, fast and dangerous races of recent months have been exciting to follow, but this race is the most beautiful, the most prestigious. Whoever wins it will be crowned Tour Champion!

This season, the Champion crushed the competition and won all the events. But her challengers all want to take her place in this final stage!Will the Champion win the race? What impression will these Pilots leave? Who will we see again on the Tour? Who won’t finish the race? All these answers (and more) in our live stream!

Final Lap is by Nicolas “Gulix” Ronvel and it available here https://gulix.itch.io/final-lap

Media Touchstones: Rush, Redline
System : Descended from the Queen
Safety Tools : X-Card, Lines and Veils, Open Door
Code of Conduct: This event adheres to the Gauntlet Community Code of Conduct
Technology : Zoom
Recording : Yes, but made public only with all players’ enthusiastic consent!
Duration : A single 3-hour session
Breaks : Two 5-10 minute breaks or as required

Read full topic

item.title: Time Out! A sports anthology
item.dc:creator: @DeReel
item.description:
@DeReel wrote:

Hello,
I had a change of plan for these hollydays. This means I won’t be in a place with a stable connexion on the night of the 3rd: I therefore leave my seat for next tuesday Haykyu! game.

I left the seat for the may 10th, too, so that the same person can play both nights. If the seat is vacant on the 10, I’ll gladly take it, though.

Read full topic
